description: Examine network diagrams to verify they identify all connections between the CDE and other networks
Examine data retention and disposal policies and procedures to verify that data is only retained for as long as necessary.
Interview responsible personnel to verify that data retention and disposal policies are defined and understood.
Examine system configurations or display settings to verify that PAN is masked when displayed.
Observe screens displaying PAN to verify that only the first six and last four digits are displayed.
Examine the targeted risk analysis (TRA) to verify that the frequency of periodic malware scans is defined.
Examine policies and procedures to verify processes are defined to detect and protect personnel against phishing attacks.
Observe security controls to verify that automated mechanisms are in place to detect and protect personnel against phishing.
Examine the inventory of bespoke and custom software to verify it is maintained and includes all custom software.
Examine configurations and script authorization records to verify a method is implemented to confirm each payment page script is authorized.
Examine system configuration settings to verify that passwords are required to be a minimum length of 12 characters and contain both numeric and alphabetic characters.
Examine system configuration settings to verify that individuals cannot submit a new password that is the same as any of the last four passwords used.
Examine configurations and scripts for application and system accounts to verify passwords/passphrases are protected against misuse.
Examine configuration settings to verify a change- and tamper-detection mechanism is deployed for payment pages.
Verify via observation or testing that the mechanism alerts personnel to unauthorized modifications of HTTP headers or page content.
Examine documentation to verify that PCI DSS scope is confirmed at least once every 12 months.
Interview responsible personnel to verify that the scope confirmation is accurate and includes all flows and locations of cardholder data.
Examine the incident response plan to verify it includes response procedures for alerts from change-detection mechanisms and detection of unencrypted PAN.
